title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
8-9:

  • Thesis is clear and well developed and reflects an understanding of change or continuity. Thesis is supported with substantial, relevant information.

  • Answer demonstrates an understanding of the complexity of the question and includes a clear grasp of change or continuity.

  • Essay effectively analyzes American political ideas and institutions.

  • Essay may contain minor errors.

5-7:

  • Thesis is limited in focus, or partially developed.

  • Answer supports the thesis with some factual, relevant information.

  • Essay shows a limited understanding of complexity but has some sense of change or continuity.

  • Essay describes and/or explains American political ideas or institutions.

  • Answer may contain errors that do not detract from the overall argument.

2-4:

  • Thesis is confused, undeveloped, or missing.

  • Answer lacks supporting information, or information is minimal or irrelevant.

  • Essay shows little or no understanding of complexity.

  • Essay describes the period with little or no treatment of political ideas or institutions.

  • Answer may contain major errors.

0-1:

  • Answer simply paraphrases or restates the question.

  • Response shows little or no understanding of the question and/or the time period.
